definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
cloth/to declare/to announce/to spread/to make known

sentences.english: I found a serious bug in my add-on, and I really want to get the fix up there quickly.
sentences.chinese: 我的附加組件已經發布，用戶看上去很喜歡。

sentences.english: Two Italian regions, Lombardy and Emilia Romagna, have already requested that a state of emergency be declared.
sentences.chinese: 意大利的倫巴第和羅馬涅兩個地區已經發布緊急狀態。

sentences.english: Reviewers tend to ignore video-on-demand releases.
sentences.chinese: 評論家傾向於忽視視頻點播發布。

sentences.english: You can't edit messages once they have been posted - the only option is to delete the whole message.
sentences.chinese: 你無法編輯已經發布的消息，只能整條刪除。

sentences.english: You can get pre-releases, plus unique exclusive tracks and remixes.
sentences.chinese: 你可以預先發布，加上獨家收錄的歌曲和混音。

sentences.english: This will be followed up by CR2 release in the beginning of August.
The second single, "A-Punk", was released in early 2008.
sentences.chinese: 第二單，一個朋克，是2008年初發布。

sentences.english: The American Psychological Association published a study about the "boomerang effect of gossip."
sentences.chinese: 美國心理協會發布了一個關於“閒談的飛反效應”。

sentences.english: Actual product release is almost a non-event.
sentences.chinese: 一次性發布產品幾乎是不可能的。

sentences.english: P.S. I added the last two sentences shortly after originally posting the item.
sentences.chinese: 最初發布項目後，我添加了最後兩句。

sentences.english: At the end of each year, the Associated Press releases a list of the top 10 news stories of the year.
sentences.chinese: 每年底，美聯社都會發布年度十大新聞事件表。

sentences.english: All supporting department on-duty arrangement and contact phone number should be handed in to President Office for announcement.
sentences.chinese: 各支持部門值班安排及聯繫電話交總經辦統一發布。

sentences.english: to validate the entire radio before it is released to the public.
sentences.chinese: 以便在對外發布之前把所有的廣播功能都測試一遍。

sentences.english: Morning. I need that Kafka's Motorbike release by 11:00.
sentences.chinese: 早，“卡夫卡摩托車”要在十一點發布新書促銷新聞。

sentences.english: Sharp said it would not immediately release the new Aquos overseas.
sentences.chinese: 夏普稱不會即刻向海外發布新款水合離子電視機。

sentences.english: I have posted that questionnaire for you to copy and complete.
sentences.chinese: 我已經發布的問卷供您複製和填答。

definition: to release/to issue/to announce/to distribute/also written 發布|发布[fa1 bu4]
to inform/to report/to make known/report/speech/talk/lecture/CL:篇[pian1],份[fen4],個|个[ge4],通[tong4]
to start (a machine)/(fig.) to set in motion/to launch (an operation)/to activate (a plan)
auxiliary verb introducing future action: may (be able to)/will (cause)/should (enable)/going to
to target/to focus on/to be aimed at or against/in response to
